menstruation (= the process of blood flowing from the uterus each month) that is very heavy or lasts for a long time: Around 1 in 3 women suffer from heavy periods or menorrhagia. Iron deficiency is a common consequence of menorrhagia.
More examplesFewer examplesVitamin A seems to be very effective in treating menorrhagia.We report a 43 year-old woman who presented with menorrhagia, pelvic pressure, and pain.About 60,000 hysterectomies are carried out each year, half of which are because of menorrhagia.
